word_mean: 腿(尤指小腿)：下肢在膝和踝之间的部分
通常用指整个下肢，此时，该部分称为小腿
拖网上下纲在网袖前端不装网衣的延伸部分。
在杆件式支架或液压支架中，立于底板、底梁或底座上，用于支撑顶梁的构件或部件（如液压缸)。

sentence.Network_en: He had to have one leg amputated above the knee.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的一条腿不得不从膝部以上截断。

sentence.Network_en: He heaved his crippled leg into an easier position.
sentence.Network_cn: 他把自己的一条瘸腿抬到一个更加舒服的位置。

sentence.Network_en: First he kicked the left leg, then he kicked the right.
sentence.Network_cn: 他先踢左腿，然后踢右腿。

phrase.cizu_name: not have a leg to stand on

jx.jx_en_mean: have no facts or sound reasons to support one's argument or justify one's actions
(Brit. informal)standing up to make a speech

lj.lj_ly: he wasn't afraid to get up on his hind legs at a social gathering and talk.
lj.lj_ls: 他不怕在社交聚会上起立发言。

jx.jx_en_mean: near the end of life, usefulness, or existence

lj.lj_ly: the foundry business was on its last legs.

jx.jx_en_mean: A justifiable or logical basis for defense; support
jx.jx_cn_mean: 站得住脚的基础：有根据、符合逻辑的辩护基础；支持

lj.lj_ly: He doesn't have a leg to stand on in this debate.

phrase.cizu_name: a leg to stand on&I{【俚语】}

jx.jx_en_mean: The act or an instance of assisting; a boost.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 帮助：协助的行为或实例；支援

jx.jx_en_mean: A position of advantage; an edge

lj.lj_ly: We have a leg up on the competition.
lj.lj_ls: 我们在这次竞争中享有优势

jx.jx_en_mean: At the end of one's strength or resources; ready to collapse, fail, or die.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 枯竭，江郎才尽：某人力量或才智的尽头；即将崩溃、失败或死亡

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (superseding shank): from Old Norse leggr (compare with Danish læg 'calf (of the leg'), of Germanic origin

entry.def: A person or animal's legs are the long parts of their body that they use to stand on.

example.ex: He was tapping his walking stick against his leg.

entry.def: The legs of a pair of trousers are the parts that cover your legs.

example.ex: He moved on through wet grass that soaked his trouser legs.
example.tran: 他继续前行，穿过湿漉漉的草地，裤腿全湿透了。

entry.def: A leg of lamb, pork, chicken, or other meat is a piece of meat that consists of the animal's or bird's leg, especially the thigh.
The legs of a table, chair, or other piece of furniture are the parts that rest on the floor and support the furniture's weight.

example.ex: His ankles were tied to the legs of the chair...
example.tran: 他的脚脖子被绑在椅腿上。

example.ex: The teak table has fluted legs.
example.tran: 这张柚木桌子的桌腿有凹槽纹饰。

entry.def: A leg of a long journey is one part of it, usually between two points where you stop.

example.ex: The first leg of the journey was by boat to Lake Naivasha in Kenya.
example.tran: 行程的首段是乘船到肯尼亚的奈瓦沙湖。

entry.def: A leg of a sports competition is one of a series of games that are played to find an overall winner.

example.ex: The first round of the cup was decided over two legs...
example.tran: 杯赛的首轮以两场分胜负。

example.ex: They will televise both legs of Leeds' European Cup clash with Rangers.
example.tran: 欧洲杯利兹联队与流浪者队的两场争夺战都将进行电视转播。

entry.def: If you leg it, you run very quickly, usually in order to escape from someone.

example.ex: We saw some kids shinning up a drainpipe before legging it clutching a TV and hi-fi...
example.tran: 我们看见几个年轻人爬上了排水管，后来就见他们提着一台电视机和音响跑掉了。

example.ex: He was now to be seen legging it across the field.
example.tran: 现在可以看到他快步跑过田地。

entry.def: If you say that something or someone is on their last legs, you mean that the period of time when they were successful or strong is ending.

example.ex: This relationship is on its last legs.
example.tran: 这段关系已经快玩儿完了。

entry.def: If you are pulling someone's leg, you are teasing them by telling them something shocking or worrying as a joke.

example.ex: Of course I won't tell them; I was only pulling your leg.
example.tran: 我当然不会告诉他们啦。我跟你开玩笑的。

entry.tran: 能够证实/无法证实；站得住脚/站不住脚
entry.def: If you say that someone does not have a leg to stand on, or hasn't got a leg to stand on, you mean that a statement or claim they have made cannot be justified or proved.

example.ex: It's only my word against his, I know. So I don't have a leg to stand on.
example.tran: 现在是我和他各说各的，这我知道。所以我的话无法证实。

entry.def: If an idea, plan, or activity has legs, it is likely to continue or succeed.

example.ex: The American economy still has legs.
example.tran: 美国经济仍可持续发展。

means.word_mean: 1. a human limb; commonly used to refer to a whole limb but technically only the part between the knee and ankle
2. a structure in animals that is similar to a human leg and used for locomotion
3. one of the supports for a piece of furniture
4. a part of a forked or branching shape;

sentences.sentence: "he broke off one of the branches"

means.word_mean: 5. the limb of an animal used for food
6. a prosthesis that replaces a missing leg
7. cloth covering consisting of the part of a garment that covers the leg
8. (nautical) the distance traveled by a sailing vessel on a single tack
9. a section or portion of a journey or course;

sentences.sentence: "then we embarked on the second stage of our Caribbean cruise"

list.explanation: (常用于祈使句)赶快，赶紧，加快速度

example.en: Shake a leg there! We'll never finish if you don't hurry up.
example.zh: 加快一点吧!要是你们不抓紧，我们就完不成了。

example.en: She told me to shake a leg,so I hurried the best I could.
example.zh: 她叫我加快速度，所以我就拼命地赶。

example.en: Let's shake a leg. The music's great.
example.zh: 咱们去跳舞吧。 这音乐很棒。

list.explanation: 同某人开玩笑，取笑或捉弄某人

example.en: I suspected that he was pulling my leg.
example.zh: 我怀疑他当时是在跟我开玩笑。

auth_sentence.res_content_con: You should also use the bike leg to rehydrate.

auth_sentence.content: That should be the second leg of the assignment.
auth_sentence.res_content: That should be the second leg of the assignment.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: That should be the second leg of the assignment.

auth_sentence.content: The Pakistani soldier knew he had lost a leg.
auth_sentence.res_content: The Pakistani soldier knew he had lost a leg.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The Pakistani soldier knew he had lost a leg.

Sentence.sentence: He tells the story of a patient, a first-time mother who complained that her young son was always clinging to her, wrapping himself around her legs wherever she went.
It's rather remarkable for the fact that although it's extremely big, it's supported by just six rather slim legs.
It is very big, with only six slim legs

sentences.en: He is lame in the right leg.
She bought a leg of mutton.
The leg of my tights has torn.
sentences.cn: 我的连裤袜的裤腿坏了。

sentences.en: Stand the table on its legs, so that the top is horizontal.
sentences.cn: 把这桌子立起来, 使桌面成水平状。

jushi.english: From Bombay we made a long leg to Singapore.
jushi.chinese: 我们从孟买到新加坡的一段旅程很长。

jushi.english: She bought a leg of mutton.
Would you like some leg or some breast of turkey.
jushi.chinese: 你要火鸡的腿肉还是胸肉?
